title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10 ยง 441.105 - Emergency service category 4-basic emergency services
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10 ยง 441.105 - Emergency service category 4-basic emergency services

State Regulations
A physician beyond the first postdoctoral year and a
registered nurse anesthetist or anesthesiologist must be available within 15
minutes of being called. Physicians with expertise in anesthesiology, surgery, internal medicine, pediatrics and obstetrics must be available within two
minutes. The facility should have an ICU with 24-hour staffing by at least one
registered nurse trained in emergency lifesaving techniques. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10
ยง
441.105

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
